name: Hotel Boutique Casa Colonial

reviews.text: My family of 3 arrived in Cuernavaca by car without hotel reservations. Too bad it was a Saturday night! We walked into the Hotel Casa Colonial to ask about room availability. There was nothing .... but the wonderful woman at the front desk called 6+ places for us before finding us 1 room at a nearby hotel. The next day we were back and stayed at the Casa Colonial for the 5 days remaining of our Cuernavaca stay. Ask for a quiet room and you'll get exactly that. Room 4 is perfect, while rooms 5, 14, and 15 rank right up there, too.
reviews.title: What a find!
Beautiful colonial hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast is excellent and a great value. A light dinner by the pool in the garden courtyard is peaceful and reasonable. Most sights are within a short walking distance. Rooms are tastefully furnished in classic Mexican; rooms are immaculate; WiFi is free;--- and actually works --- staff is great .... we look forward to returning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a wonderful colonial hotel in excellent shape with beautiful rooms and a very helpful staff. It is conveniently located in central Cuernavaca practically across from the Robert Brady museum, which is definitely worth a 1-hour visit to see how this wealthy expatriate art collector lived and decorated his home in a former convent. The hotel is gorgeous with outdoor dining, reasonably priced delicious breakfasts (I recommend Desayuna Poblano) and a wonderful restaurant whose cuisine beats Las Manianitas hands down in my opinion (the experience at Las Manianitas is still worth it though). Our room #14 was fantastic with french doors opening onto a patio overlooking the pool. The patio has a couch and chairs in front of a working fireplace. This was wonderful on one cool evening. Also the bathroom has a sauna, which our boys loved to use and jump in the pool. They had a room back behind the outdoor bar area which was great for them - king sized bed and a futon in a small side room. The experience was unsurpassed. You should really stay at this place!
reviews.title: Charming Downtown Historic Hotel with Fabulous Staff

likes.liked: — Great Value and Staff. Charming surroundings.
likes.disliked: — Voices from another room can be heard in Room #20. Room #11 had a little sewer scent.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this lovely, historic hotel located in downtown Cuernavaca in October 2007. It's in an excellent location to walk to many of the noted sites in the city. Please note, however, that it's located downtown. If you are looking for absolute quiet with all the 5-star amenities, with no city noise, this isn't the hotel for you. The common areas and grounds are absolutely lovely and peaceful. The furnishings are antique and very interesting. I highly praise their staff. Many speak English and all are very accommodating. If you are interested in hiring a private driver for day trips please inquire at the desk. Tepoztlan and Xochicalco (ruins) are easy day trips and highly recommended. We ate breakfasts at the hotel and the food was fabulous and well priced. For a special dinner I recommend the restaurant Gaia. Although we didn't stay in Room #1, the staff allowed us to view it and we will definitely reserve this room when we return. This hotel is also a great value.
reviews.title: back to colonial times

reviews.text: It was my first time at Cuernavaca. My travel agency highly recommend me to book at CASA COLONIAL. Before that I came to this web site and to have a look of the coments, which I always do before travelling.
reviews.title: wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: We spent one night at the very charming and well kept Casa Colonial (room #1 with a king bed in the front (which looked like a honeymoon suite) and room #19 with two queen beds in the back) - and wished we had stayed longer. The rooms were very spacious and clean, with your basic ammenities, including a fan. They had pretty artesan tiles and large, ornate wooden furniture, plants and lovely bedspreads. And working fire places for colder days! The ambiance at the Inn was priceless, with a gorgeous courtyard/garden and pool, and large colonial furniture with modern touches. The pool has a bar where I enjoyed a zesty Mojito.
reviews.title: Beautiful Colonial Inn, convenient location, across from central bus depot

likes.liked: — Location and charm of the property. Also, very nice staff.
likes.disliked: — If I had stayed at the front of the building, it is possible noise from the central bus station across the street would have bothered me.

reviews.title: Brutally noisy
reviews.text: The service was impeccable, and I regret not having eaten there but we had made reservations elsewhere in advance. I did enjoy a morning coffee in the outdoor restaurant by the lovely pool and it was the best coffee I drank in Mexico!

Casa Colonial is a very charming Inn, across the street from the central bus station. Therefore, be advised to request a room towards the back where you will not hear much of anything (don't forget, this is not a hermetically sealed high-rise hotel, but a lovely and lovingly kept Inn). If you do chose a room in the front, you may hear a good deal of traffic - much like most Mexicans in their homes. Nontheless, the rooms are beautiful. The buses do not run after a certain hour in the evening, so that noise does subside until about 7am in the morning.
reviews.title: Better than Las Mananitas!
perfecto
reviews.text: Otherwise, you can't beat the location and service: you've got a 10 minute walk (max) to the Cortez Palace, market, Zocalo and a 5 minute walk to the Basilica and Jardin Borda - all must see's in pretty Cuernavaca.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nestor, who manned the reception was the image of proessionalism and discreetness. He made our stay exceptional with his assistance and courteousness.
reviews.title: Cuernavaca Charm

reviews.text: Stayed at Casa Colonial for five nights during a week of Spanish language school. Having stayed in Cuernavaca before, I was a bit skeptical of the glowing reviews, because the city's Centro Historico is many wonderful things but not tranquil. But this hotel is truly magical.
reviews.title: An historic five-stars

reviews.text: It rained very hard for many days of my stay, and a small bit of water leaked through the door threshold. Didn't bother me in the least, and it was clear that the historic buildings had seen and weathered much worse. But if you must have everything wrapped up with a modern bow, this might not be the place for you. Sure, I missed having Internet access, but the pool, breakfast (an unexpected high point of each day), staff, and allure of Casa Colonial gave Cuernavaca just the right balance to its great energy. This is what a five-star hotel would have been like before corporate chains and technology changed the world.
reviews.title: Time Capsule.

reviews.text: For the budget traveler, having a small satellite bus terminal a few doors away makes it easy to get to and from Mexico City or other areas around Cuernavaca.
reviews.title: a wonderful oasis in a busy city

reviews.text: The road through Cuernavaca to the Casa Colonial is not the Bougainville lined paradise of literature. Cuernavaca is urban Mexico, make no mistake. However, when one finally finds the Casa colonial and is buzzed through the steel entrance door, the clock turns back 30 years. The hotel is an old Colonial structure with clean, spacious, simple rooms which surround a quiet garden and pool. Unlike the personnel at the larger luxury hotels, the staff at the Casa Colonial is barely noticible. However, when the need arises, someone is always there to graciously help out. Staying at the Casa is rather like being a guest in a private home. It is so centrally located, that a tourist can walk through all of Cuernavaca's major tourist sites in a couple of hours. One note of caution...this is not a five star luxury hotel. It is old and it's in the old part of town. If you are looking for 5 stars, try Las Mananitas and pay the price. One other thing...find a way to get out of town. There are some great places to see near Cuernavaca.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and location and beautiful garden and pool

reviews.text: The Casa Colonial is truly an oasis in the midst of this busy city. The exterior is plain, but once you walk into the beautiful reception and pool/garden area, you'll be amazed and very happy you booked here! The place is charming, gleamingly clean, with wonderful colonial detail. I agree with the other reviews - the staff (not only Nestor) were extremely helpful. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite (#1) with a lovely tiled large bath, shining tile floors, corner fireplaces, and view over the garden and pool from 1 of the rooms. Outside our suite was a balcony sitting area (with a fireplace), which made us feel we had another room. Breakfast by the pool was a marvelous way to start the day - We stayed at 7 different places on our trip and this was one of our top 2 favorites.
reviews.title: Five Star Service

reviews.text: I had a wedding to attend in Cuernavaca this past weekend and when Las Mañanitas was sold out, I decided to try someplace different and checked out Tripadvisor, which has had a 100% success rate for me in the past.
reviews.title: This is the first time Tripadvisor let me down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not understand the raves about Casa Colonial. Cuernavaca has dozens of charming old homes with nice gardens that serve as hotels and this one is nothing special.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience in the Heart of Cuernavaca

reviews.text: Room 6 was facing the bus depot and a cheap taco stand. It was noisy all night long with double windows closed. Hot and stuffy room, dusty, had not been aired out in a week. No air conditioning. Large size but nothing at all special in decor, I have seen much better. Bathroom had a sewer like smell and was large, but old. I had reserved room with King bed and a separate smaller bedroom for guest and this was given to me after I was being pushed to take another room with just a king bed. Maybe, I should have slept with my traveling partner as this may be the worst room in the hotel. I do not know.
reviews.title: Wonderful service but some rooms are very noisy

reviews.text: Breakfast in the garden was fine, nothing special, with limited menu of eggs or chilaquiles.
reviews.title: Loved the place
Outstanding Character at Casa Colonial
reviews.text: Plus for the property is it had a parking lot (outdoors I could see from the dirt on my car when I got it back). Other plus is it is near everything, but also too near busy, noisy streets.

description: Casa Colonial is a veritable museum of exquisite colonial art, which a warm, personalized service and modern comforts render an ideal place to spend the holidays. Guests with an eye for fine details are continually treated to delightful surprises: age-old sculptures in stone and wood and paintings, lattices in carved stone, an ornate iron stove, or a vine with delicate, brightly colored flowers against an arcade.
